intro: Pulsatilla alba, commonly known as the white pasqueflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a short, thick rhizome and produces silky, white to pale yellow hairs on its stems and leaves. Its leaves are palmately divided with lobes that are often hairy and have a waxy coating. Pulsatilla alba is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
